transcript_parts.text: after the service after i talked to a
lot of people
someone called me over can you know can
you speak with these people and they you
know how's your spanish and you know
it's a little rusty but i can understand
quite well and
and and the woman telling me the story
didn't speak much english so she told me
the whole story in spanish
and she told me that last april
she had a dream
and this dream was
was very impactful she woke up after it
she called her mother um
and in this dream there was a very tall
man who who looked very white and had a
big white beard and just was was very
big and very loud and very white
and when she came into church and when i
stood up to preach she said
there's the guy from my dream
i dreamed about this man
now
so
you want to know what the dream was it's
a very interesting dream so and in this
dream and making these little molds
these little wooden molds
and i was i was just using this
electrical saw to make these little
wooden molds
and then
the power went out and everything was
dark
and i told the people don't worry the
saw will keep working
and the saw did keep working even though
the power was out it was electrical saw
and i kept making these little wooden
molds
and well what were these little wooden
molds well
in these little wooden molds
we would basically put light
and so i was giving these little wooden
molds to the people of the church and
sending them out
as light in the darkness
that was the dream
so make of it what you will
one of the real takeaways for me from
this trip is just how practicable
this estuary protocol is at taking
people who have never done any of this
and getting them talking in a very
satisfying and productive way
and this mostly female group
reacted exactly the same way as all the
other groups that i that i've done it
with in other words the
the protocol does not seem to be uh
dependent on gender at all so no
so then
so then we had the estuary meeting and
we had i don't know if i i don't it was
